newsitem.title: UK: Coke notes EU objections to Cadbury deal.
newsitem.headline: Coke notes EU objections to Cadbury deal.

text.p: Coca-Cola Enterprises late on Monday said the Merger Task Force of the European Commission (EU) had issued a statement of objections regarding the company's acquisition of the Coca-Cola and Cadbury Schweppes Plc bottling operations in Britain.
"The statement of objections is in keeping with the Commission's review process," the company said in a statement.
"And, as expected and previously disclosed by Coca-Cola, (it) represents a preliminary analysis of the acquisition and its possible effects on the British soft drink market."
Coca-Cola said it would submit a written reply to the Commission's statement of objections.
"We believe the beverage business in Great Britain is currently, and will remain, highly competitive," Coca-Cola chief executive officer Summerfield K. Johnston Jr. said in a statement.
"We will continue to cooperate fully with the Commission's efforts to understand and evaluate this acquisition, and we remain convinced that the transaction will be approved and completed."
The Commission's final decision regarding the proposed transaction is not expected until late in January, 1997.
Under the deal that was announced on June 4, Cadbury Schweppes would receive 622.5 million stg from the sale of its 51 percent stake in British bottler Coca-Cola & Schweppes Beverages Ltd.
The EU started a review of the deal last August.
